channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Global watchdog finds Iran failing to meet nuclear obligations
item.description: Iran condemns the resolution passed by the IAEA's board of governors as "political" and says it will open a new uranium enrichment facility.

item.title: Hamas faces leadership vacuum at critical time with demise of Gaza 'War Council'
item.description: The killing of Mohammed Sinwar marks the end of the secretive group that planned the 7 October 2023 attack on Israel.

item.title: A frail cry and relief: Malnourished baby Siwar evacuated from Gaza
item.description: The BBC travels in an ambulance from the Gaza border to Amman with Siwar and her family

item.title: Six Gaza aid boat activists deported from Israel after three days in detention
item.description: Their boat was intercepted on Monday as they attempted to break Israel's naval blockade on Gaza and deliver a symbolic amount of aid.

item.title: US-backed aid group says Hamas killed at least eight Palestinian staff in bus attack
item.description: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation said the attack, which the BBC could not independently verify, came after days of threats from Hamas.

item.title: CIA analyst who leaked Israel strike plan sentenced to three years
item.description: Asif William Rahman used top security clearance to print and circulate documents over several months.

item.title: Dozens of Palestinians killed while seeking aid in Gaza, hospitals say
item.description: At least 39 reportedly die in three incidents near lorries transporting flour and aid distribution sites.

item.title: Video shows crowds in Gaza scale fence to rush for aid
item.description: Palestinians can be seen climbing over fences and running to get humanitarian aid in the footage.

item.title: Israeli forces recover bodies of two hostages in Gaza, PM says
item.description: One of the two hostages was Yair Yaakov, who was killed in the Hamas-led attack on 7 October 2023, Benjamin Netanyahu says.

item.title: Gaza doctor whose nine children were killed in Israeli strike evacuated with son
item.description: Adam al-Najjar is evacuated to Milan, where surgeons can work to save his arm which was severely damaged in the attack.

item.title: Syria government says women must wear burkinis at public beaches
item.description: The rules are aimed at "enhancing public safety standards and preserving public decency", state media reports.

item.title: Iran executes man over 2022 anti-government protests
item.description: Mojahed Kourkouri was accused of killing of a boy during the protests - even though the boy's family blamed security forces.

item.title: UK sanctions far-right Israeli ministers for 'inciting violence' against Palestinians
item.description: Five countries place travel bans on Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir and Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich.

item.title: Syria former prison guard – 'I showed them no mercy'
item.description: The BBC heard from dozens of former officials about their role enforcing the brutality of the Assad regime.

item.title: Bowen: Israel is accused of the gravest war crimes - how governments respond could haunt them for years
item.description: Distinguished lawyers, senior humanitarians and diplomats tell Jeremy Bowen why they are increasingly concerned about the catastrophe inside Gaza.

item.title: 'I begged for help, but only God answered': Growing dangers of pregnancy and childbirth in Gaza
item.description: Rather than representing the hope of new life, babies in Gaza have come to epitomise the struggle to survive.

item.title: The Today Debate: Israel-Gaza - are we witnessing war crimes?
item.description: The BBC’s Anna Foster hosts a debate to discuss whether there have been war crimes in Israel and Gaza.

item.title: Hopes of parenthood crushed after IVF embryos destroyed in Israel's Gaza offensive
item.description: Couples in Gaza using IVF to help them conceive “left with nothing” after 4,000 embryos at an IVF clinic were destroyed.

item.title: 'Situation is dire' - BBC returns to Gaza baby left hungry by Israeli blockade
item.description: Malnourished five-month-old baby Siwar is now out of hospital in Gaza - but as we found, she and her family are struggling.

item.title: Chaos spreads as desperate Gazans wait for food to arrive
item.description: Lawlessness is stopping food from reaching people, while a clash at an aid convoy on Thursday night turned deadly.

item.title: As Israel faces diplomatic 'tsunami', Trump is staying quiet
item.description: This has been a tumultuous week for the Jewish state, the BBC's Paul Adams writes.

item.title: What we know about Israeli embassy staff shooting
item.description: Police say the victims, a young couple, were shot by a man who shouted "free, free Palestine".

item.title: Investigating Israel's strike on Gaza's European Hospital
item.description: BBC Verify analysed footage, gathered witness testimony and spoke to munitions and legal experts to examine how one of Gaza's last functioning hospitals came under Israeli attack.

item.title: Paul Adams: Starmer and Lammy sound genuinely angry at Israel
item.description: The PM sounded genuinely angry at Israel's aid blockade and expanded Gaza offensive, writes diplomatic correspondent Paul Adams.

item.title: Jeremy Bowen: Goodwill running out as UK, France and Canada demand Israel end Gaza offensive
item.description: France, the UK and Canada are among nations that have sharpened their criticism of Israel's ground offensive.

item.title: Did Trump really strike Gulf deals worth $2tn?
item.description: Some analysts question whether the amount of investment will ultimately be that high.

item.title: Trump's frantic week of peace brokering hints at what he really wants
item.description: After seven breathless days of diplomatic hurly burly, we have a clearer idea of the US president's global ideology - and the limits of his 'art of a deal'.

item.title: 'My children go to sleep hungry,' Gazans tell the BBC
item.description: The BBC speaks to people in Gaza during a 10-week blockade on food, medical supplies and other aid.

item.title: Video shows crowds in Gaza scale fence to rush for aid
item.description: Palestinians can be seen climbing over fences and running to get humanitarian aid in the footage.

item.title: BBC Verify examines tunnels footage after IDF says Hamas leader body found
item.description: The IDF have released new footage that they say shows the underground tunnel network underneath the European hospital in southern Gaza. BBC Verify pieces together the evidence.

item.title: Watch: Moment Israeli forces board Gaza aid boat
item.description: Onboard security footage from the Madleen aid vessel shows activists throwing their tech overboard and putting up their hands.

item.title: Act now to save lives in Gaza, ICRC head urges world leaders
item.description: Mirjana Spoljaric has appealed to world leaders to intervene in the conflict in Gaza.
